result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russel S. SLIWINSKI

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in both counts.  The defendant plead to charges in 15 CF 267, 14 CM 295 and 14 CM 411.  Motion granted.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 11-04-15 at 9:00 a.m.
Plea date set for 11-04-15 at 9:00 a.m.

This case is riding along with 15 CF 267.  Settlement conference with D.A. is set for 09-10-15 at 11:00 a.m.
Minutes.

Request for Adjournment;  Order for Adjournment.

Jury trial reset for 07-15-15 at 8:30 a.m.. #1 position.

No agreement.

Jury trial set for 06-09-15 at 8:30 a.m., #2 position.

Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-28-14 at 3:45 p.m.  Plea date is set for 01-29-15 at 10:30 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 09-26-14 at 8:30 a.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of escape and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-22-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond. Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody serving a sentence.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
